item.title: Visualizing Gerrymandering (part 1)
item.description: Introduction There is a saying that goes (more or less) by: In a majority electoral system, the voters chooses their representatives. With electoral districts, the representatives choose their constituencies. Because new district boundaries are drawn by incumbents every new Census[1] in the United States, it is of their critical interest to do so in ways to include only the voters that maxes out their chances to remain in power.
